title: Comparative-Text Analysis Strategies for Synthesizing and Critically Evaluating Scientific Arguments

context.prior_knowledge: Understanding of basic scientific concepts and secondary education experience
context.additional_context: Job competency enhancement program for current secondary school teachers

learning_goals: Learners can systematically summarize contrasting scientific texts using compare-contrast analysis strategies.
Learners can selectively comprehend key information in scientific debates using the "read-pause-think-note" strategy.
Learners can express critical connections between scientific debates in sentences by applying meaning-to-text transformation strategies.
Learners can improve their comprehensive scientific debate abilities by over 20% based on formative assessment feedback.

resources: LMS platform (video lectures, discussion board, assignment submission system)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
